name: Beef & Bean Minestrone

ingredients.name: small pasta such as ditalini, macaroni, or shells
Marinara Sauce Mix or Italian Seasoning

preparation: In 8-quart programmable pressure cooker, program to SAUTÉ. Heat oil; add beef, breaking up chunks as needed.
Drain and rinse beans. Dice zucchini. Add beans, zucchini, tomatoes, water, pasta, and mixes to pot.

Secure lid. Place steam release valve in SEALING position. Press MANUAL button, select HIGH, and set the time to 5 min. This will take some time to get up to temperature before the timer starts to count down.
When the cook time has finished, naturally release pressure for 10 min.
Using a long-handled spoon, push the steam release valve to VENTING position. Release pressure completely before opening lid.
Just before serving, stir in spinach.
In sauté pan, heat oil over medium-high heat. Brown beef, breaking up chunks as needed. Transfer to a 6-quart slow cooker.
Drain and rinse beans. Dice zucchini. Add beans, zucchini, tomatoes, water, pasta, and mixes to slow cooker. Cover; cook on high 3 hours. The liquid should be bubbling.
With about 20 min cook time to go, add pasta. Stir to combine. Cover; cook remaining 20 min or until pasta is tender.
Just before serving, stir in spinach.
tips: Swap zucchini for 2 cups frozen or fresh mixed vegetables of your choice.

products.name: Marinara Sauce Mix
summary: A simple, kid-friendly sauce that speaks volumes, Marinara is packed with the bright flavor of garlic, oregano, and basil. Pair it with your fave pasta and use it as a base layer for delicious homemade pizza.

products.name: Italian Seasoning
summary: A robust Italian blend perfect for pizza, bread dough, pasta or flatbreads.

products.name: Nourish Broth Mix
summary: Rich taste of slowly simmered chicken with garden-fresh flavours of onion, celery, and herbs. Just add water!

products.name: Vegetable Broth Mix
summary: Make a tasty vegetable broth in a matter of seconds! Same garden-fresh flavor as making it from scratch—just add water!
